Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2008 11:16PM CIPRO117 wrote:  hi deb, my wife was also diagnosed triple neg chest wall recurrence with lung mets last april 2008, she is 41,  she is still undergoing 3rd cycle chemo of xeloda and taxotere. i know how hard it is to cope up. We will include you in our prayers that God will give us all strength to face our uncertainties ...i am not very good with words but we are with you....
Posts.Title: Boost my spirits...long term trip neg mets stories please AlaskaDeb twink

Posts.Content: CIPRO117 wrote: good pm to all of you, i have been lurking for the past several days reading the threads here until I finally decided to write here. My wife was 35 y/o when she was first diagnosed back in sept 2002. dx invasive ductal ca Shes stage 11b with 1 node positive. she underwent  MODIFIED RADICAL MASTECTOMY and  chemo AC 4 cycles ER + and PR+ and her 2 neg so she was on tamoxifen for 5 years... Last month april 2008, she was diagnosed with chest wall recurrence on the pectoralis muscle and it was excised 3.5 cm with + 33/34 matted lymph nodes in the muscle and the  supraclavicular area  with clear margins. Further exam revealed the hormonal status of the tumor changed to triple neg . metastatic work up negative in the liver and bones but questionable in the lungs( several subcentimeters nodules in both lungs) by CT scan. our surgical onco did not suggest biopsy of the lung nodules because they are too small and shes going to have chemo anyway  because of the chest wall recurrence  Presently she is on her 2nd cycle of taxotere and xeloda ..it has been very  difficult for both of us since then to accept that at her age  of 41 now, we are dealing with this kind of problem...   would like to ask for any inputs.... btw we are from the philippines.. tnks Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: its my wife CIPRO117 LumiPojo

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2008 09:17AM CIPRO117 wrote: to linda, my wife will be on her third cycle of taxotere next saturday ( every 3 weeks) and xeloda ( 2wks and 1 wk off) 3 tabs in the morning and 3 tabs at night, she seems to be tolerating it well, except for occasional nausea and metallic taste in the mouth, plus the hair falling off. She is injected with granocyte on the 4th and 6th day after chemo because the wbc and neutrophils goes down but on the 8th day it goes back up to normal levels. we will have repeat ct scan after the 3rd cycle.. will get in touch with you if i have questions. tnks
Posts.Title: its my wife CIPRO117 LumiPojo

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2008 09:05AM CIPRO117 wrote: to oz, bobbie, bernice and linda thank you to all of you for your concern and prayers this is really such a nice site because, here i read of the actual feelings and concerns of people afflicted with breast cancer as well as the feelings and concern of their love ones. Words coming from all of you means more because we know you understand what we are going through because you have been there.. thanks again... our prayers for  all of you as well
Posts.Title: its my wife CIPRO117 LumiPojo

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2009 05:08AM CIPRO117 wrote:  my wife who had breast cancer recurrence in the chest wall last april 21, 2008. That is after 5 years of the primary breast cancer being operated on her R breast. Our surgeon removed the tumor and the sorrounding lymph nodes, underwent 6 rounds of taxotere and xeloda and 33 doses of radiation treatment in the tumor site.. Presently she is undergoing Dendritic Cell Vaccination or immunotheraphy. anybody here who has experienced or undergoing the same treatment? i understand that this is also involves stem cells?
